chapter.title: &rhla; Pre-Installation Checks
chapter.para: When provisioning a &rh; compute node, you should be aware of the below issues and take any appropriate steps for your environmnet.

section.title: Sample iptables rules must be removed on &rh;
section.para: &product; uses iptables to secure access to &clm; network interfaces and on &rh; this requires the package iptables-services to be installed. The package will provide sample iptables configurations for IPv4 and IPv6 if none existed before. This sample configuration is inappropriate for &productname; operation and the node will not be able to run &productname; with these rules installed.

If these files do not exist on the candidate &rh; systems, the rest of this note may be skipped. However, if these files do exist, there are a number of steps that you must follow before you install &product;.
The default contents of these two files are displayed here for reference:
section.screen: # sample configuration for iptables service # you can edit this manually or use system-config-firewall # please do not ask us to add additional ports/services to this default configuration *filter :INPUT ACCEPT [0:0] :FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0] :OUTPUT ACCEPT [0:0] -A INPUT -m state --state RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -p icmp -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -i lo -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -p tcp -m state --state NEW -m tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited -A FORWARD -j REJECT --reject-with icmp-host-prohibited COMMIT

# sample configuration for ip6tables service # you can edit this manually or use system-config-firewall # please do not ask us to add additional ports/services to this default configuration *filter :INPUT ACCEPT [0:0] :FORWARD ACCEPT [0:0] :OUTPUT ACCEPT [0:0] -A INPUT -m state --state RELATED,ESTABLISHED -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -p ipv6-icmp -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -i lo -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -p tcp -m state --state NEW -m tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -d fe80::/64 -p udp -m udp --dport 546 -m state --state NEW -j ACCEPT -A INPUT -j REJECT --reject-with icmp6-adm-prohibited -A FORWARD -j REJECT --reject-with icmp6-adm-prohibited COMMIT
section.para: By default, these rules are applied to network traffic on all interfaces on the system, whereas &productname; components and OpenStack components manage interface-specific rules. With reference to the security policies that you may require for your environment, it is essential that you either:

listitem.para: Delete the files /etc/sysconfig/iptables and /etc/sysconfig/ip6tables so that they do not interfere with the new rules that will be applied during the &productname; installation.
Or, if certain rules are necessary in your environment, ensure that any remaining rules are limited to interfaces not used by &productname;.

important.para: If these files existed on your system, and did contain content, the corresponding rules are currently installed and active on the system. Once you delete these two files (or edit them to limit the rules to interfaces not used by &productname;), you will need to reboot the system to activate the new settings.

section.title: Cobbler Support Removed
section.para: Cobbler support for deploying &rhel; compute nodes has been removed. Use your normal &rhel; deployment tools instead of the deprecated Cobbler support.
